greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of 8-core partitions of n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
maple: with(numtheory): A:= proc(n, t) option remember; local d, j; `if`(n=0, 1, add(add(`if`(t=0 or irem(d, t)=0, d-d*t, d), d=divisors(j)) *A(n-j, t), j=1..n)/n) end: seq(A(n,8), n=0..50);
mathematica: A[n_, t_] := A[n, t] = If[n == 0, 1, Sum[Sum[If[t == 0 || Mod[d, t] == 0, d - d*t, d], {d, Divisors[j]}]*A[n - j, t], {j, 1, n}]/n];
Table[A[n, 8], {n, 0, 50}] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, May 21 2018, translated form Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Dec 03 2010
